sen.j: 明日香村（あすかむら）は、奈良県の中央部に位置する村。
sen.e: Asuka Vilage is a village located in the center of Nara Prefecture.
Asuka-mura is a village located in the center of Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 地名のため、Asuka-muraとしました。
sen.e: Asuka-mura is a village located in the center of Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 中央集権律令国家の誕生の地である事から飛鳥時代の宮殿や史跡が多く発掘されている事で知られ、「日本の心の故郷」とも紹介される。
sen.e: Since it is a birthplace of the centralized state under the Ritsuryo system, a lot of palaces and historical sites of the Asuka period were excavated and the village is introuced as 'a mental hometown to the Japanese.'

Since it is a birthplace of the centralized state under the Ritsuryo system, a lot of palaces and historical sites of the Asuka period were excavated and the village is introuced as 'a mental hometown to the Japanese.'

Since it is a birthplace of the centralized state under the Ritsuryo system, a lot of palaces and historical sites of the Asuka period were excavated and the village is introuced as 'a mental hometown to the Japanese.'

sen.j: 日本で唯一全域が古都保存法対象地域の自治体である。
sen.e: The entire village is the only municipality supported by 'Koto Hozon ho (The Ancient Capitals Preservation Law).'
The entire village is the only municipality supported by 'Koto Hozon ho' (The Ancient Capitals Preservation Law).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: The entire village is the only municipality supported by 'Koto Hozon ho' (The Ancient Capitals Preservation Law).

sen.j: また、村全体の世界遺産登録に向けた計画が具体化している。
sen.e: In addition, the plan to register the village on the World Heritage list is taking shape.
sen.cmt: 具体化した（現在完了形）なのか、具体化しつつある（現在進行形）なのか、わかりませんでした。
sen.e: In addition, the plan to register the village on the World Heritage list is taking shape.
In addition, the plan to register the village on the World Heritage list is taking shape.
Rivers: Asuka-gawa River
Rivers: Asuka-gawa River
Rivers: Asuka-gawa River

sen.j: まわりを丘や山に囲まれた小さな盆地にある。
sen.e: The village is in a small basin surrounded by hills and mountains.
The village is in a small basin surrounded by hills and mountains.
The village is in a small basin surrounded by hills and mountains.

sen.j: 橿原市、桜井市、高市郡高取町、吉野郡吉野町
sen.e: Kashihara City, Sakurai City, Takatori-cho, Takaichi County, Yoshino-cho, Yoshino-gun
Kashihara City, Sakurai City, Takatori-cho, Takaichi County, Yoshino-cho, Yoshino County

tit.cmt: timesの頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.e: Refer to the Asuka period.
Refer to the Asuka period.
Refer to the Asuka period.

sen.j: 1956年 旧高市郡阪合村、高市村、飛鳥村の三村が合併をして「明日香村」になる。
sen.e: In 1856, Sakaai, Takaichi and Asuka villages in the former Takaichi County were merged into 'Asuka Village,'
1856: Three villages of Sakaai, Takaichi and Asuka in the former Takaichi County were merged into 'Asuka-mura.'
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、一部訳文を修正、カンマ→ピリオドに修正
sen.e: 1856: Three villages of Sakaai, Takaichi and Asuka in the former Takaichi County were merged into 'Asuka-mura.'

sen.j: 1972年 高松塚古墳から彩色壁画が発見される。
sen.e: In 1972, colored wall paintings were discovered in Takamatsuzuka Tomb.
1972: Colored wall paintings were discovered in Takamatsuzuka-kofun Tumulus.
1972: Colored wall paintings were discovered in Takamatsuzuka-kofun Tumulus.

sen.j: 松下幸之助がひいきにしていた大阪の鍼灸師・御井敬三が、明日香村の遺跡の保存を訴え、松下から佐藤栄作首相へと伝えられたことから、法制化へと進んだ。
sen.e: Keizo MII, apractitioner of acupuncture and moxibustion, who was patronized by Konosuke MATSUSHITA, insisted on the preservation of the remains of Asuka Village; Matsushita asked Eisaku SATO, then Prime Minister to help the preservation, and the law to preserve the remains was established.

Keizo MII, a practitioner of acupuncture and moxibustion, who was patronized by Konosuke MATSUSHITA, insisted on the preservation of the remains of Asuka-mura; Matsushita asked Eisaku SATO, then Prime Minister to help the preservation, and the law to preserve the remains was established.
sen.cmt: apractitioner→a practitionerに修正、Asuka-muraとしました。
sen.e: Keizo MII, a practitioner of acupuncture and moxibustion, who was patronized by Konosuke MATSUSHITA, insisted on the preservation of the remains of Asuka-mura; Matsushita asked Eisaku SATO, then Prime Minister to help the preservation, and the law to preserve the remains was established.

sen.j: これとは別に三木睦子らによる保存運動もあった。
sen.e: Aside from this, there were some the preservation movements, one of which was led by Mutsuko MIKI.
Aside from this, there were some the preservation movements, one of which was led by Mutsuko MIKI.
Aside from this, there were some the preservation movements, one of which was led by Mutsuko MIKI.

sen.j: 1980年（昭和55）5月「明日香村における歴史的風土の保存及び生活環境の整備等に関する特別措置法（明日香法）」、略して「明日香村特別措置法」といい、二つの柱からなっている、一つは、村内全域が歴史的風土保存の対象となっている。
sen.e: In May, 1980, "Special Measures Law Concerning Preservation of Historical Natural Features and Maintenance of Living Environment in Asuka Village (Asuka Law)", or Asuka Village Special Measures Law in abbriviation, was issued and it has two pillows; one is to preserve the entire village as a historical landscape preserved district.

In May, 1980, 'Special Measures Law Concerning Preservation of Historical Natural Features and Maintenance of Living Environment in Asuka Village (Asuka Law),' or Asuka Village Special Measures Law in abbriviation, was issued and it has two pillows; one is to preserve the entire village as a historical landscape preserved district.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、カンマの位置を移動
sen.e: In May, 1980, 'Special Measures Law Concerning Preservation of Historical Natural Features and Maintenance of Living Environment in Asuka Village (Asuka Law),' or Asuka Village Special Measures Law in abbriviation, was issued and it has two pillows; one is to preserve the entire village as a historical landscape preserved district.

sen.j: 駅前の一部以外を除いてほとんどが風致地区であり、建築には厳しい制限がかけられている。
sen.e: Except some areas in front of the station, almost all the areas in Asuka Village are scenic areas and strict restrictions are imposed on construction.
Except some areas in front of the station, almost all the areas in Asuka-mura are scenic areas and strict restrictions are imposed on construction.
Except some areas in front of the station, almost all the areas in Asuka-mura are scenic areas and strict restrictions are imposed on construction.

sen.j: 二つは、住民の生活安定を目的としている。
sen.e: The second pillow aims the stabilization of the villagers' lives.
The second pillow aims the stabilization of the villagers' lives.
The second pillow aims the stabilization of the villagers' lives.

sen.j: 村の全域を歴史的風土保存地区
sen.e: The entire village as a historical landscape preserved district
The entire village as a historical landscape preserved district
The entire village as a historical landscape preserved district

sen.j: 第一種地区は、石舞台古墳、高松塚古墳、岡寺、伝飛鳥板葺宮跡（飛鳥京跡）、甘樫丘を中心とする地域。
sen.e: The first district includes Ishibutai Tumbs, Takamatsuzuka Tumbs, Oka-dera Temple, Denasuka-iyabukinomiya-ato (Asukakyo Site) and Amakashi no oka Hill.
The first district includes Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus, Takamatsuzuka-kofun Tumulus, Oka-dera Temple, the supposed site of Asuka Itabuki no miya Palace (Asukakyo Site) and Amakashi no oka Hill.
sen.cmt: Tumbs→-kofun Tumulus、Denasuka-iyabukinomiya-at→the supposed site of Asuka Itabuki no miya Palaceに修正 (参照: http://www.asukanet.gr.jp/asukahome/ASUKA2/ASUKAMIYA/itabukimiya.html)
sen.e: The first district includes Ishibutai-kofun Tumulus, Takamatsuzuka-kofun Tumulus, Oka-dera Temple, the supposed site of Asuka Itabuki no miya Palace (Asukakyo Site) and Amakashi no oka Hill.

sen.j: 現状変更が厳しく規制されている。
sen.e: Strict restrictions are imposed on changing the current conditions.
Strict restrictions are imposed on changing the current conditions.
Strict restrictions are imposed on changing the current conditions.

sen.j: 第二種地区は、第一種地区以外の地域で、著しい現状変更については抑制されるものの、そうでない場合は許可される。
sen.e: The second district includes the areas except the first district, where changing the current conditions markedly is not restricted while subtle changes are allowed.
The second district includes the areas except the first district, where changing the current conditions markedly is not restricted while subtle changes are allowed.
The second district includes the areas except the first district, where changing the current conditions markedly is not restricted while subtle changes are allowed.

sen.j: 明日香村の整備計画と整備基金
sen.e: The development plan and fund for Asuka Village.
The development plan and fund for Asuka-mura
The development plan and fund for Asuka-mura

sen.j: 整備計画は、明日香村の歴史的風土の維持・保存と同時に、生活環境を整え村を発展させていくため、道路・下水道・公園・教育施設・農業環境などの整備をはかる。
sen.e: The development plan aims to preserve and maitain the historical landscape of Asuka Village and, at the same time, to develop and adjust streets, sewers, parks, educational facilities and agricultural environment.

The development plan aims to preserve and maitain the historical landscape of Asuka-mura and, at the same time, to develop and adjust streets, sewers, parks, educational facilities and agricultural environment.

The development plan aims to preserve and maitain the historical landscape of Asuka-mura and, at the same time, to develop and adjust streets, sewers, parks, educational facilities and agricultural environment.

sen.j: 遺跡・景観保全のためやむを得ないが、この厳しい開発規制のため人口は減少している。
sen.e: The village's population has been decreasing because of these strict regulations, which is unavoidable in order to preserve historical sites and scenery.
The village's population has been decreasing because of these strict regulations, which is unavoidable in order to preserve historical sites and scenery.
The village's population has been decreasing because of these strict regulations, which is unavoidable in order to preserve historical sites and scenery.

sen.j: 観光にバスを使う場合、2つ北の橿原神宮前駅（近畿日本鉄道近鉄南大阪線・近鉄橿原線）の方が本数が多く便利である。
sen.e: In travelling by bus for sightseeing, it is more convenient to go to Kashiharajingu-mae Station (Kinki Nippon Railway Company, Kintetsu Minamiosaka Line/Kintetsu Kashihara Line), two stations to the north, where "the frequency of buses is better.
